examples: PRESENT IND: A cat is sitting on the mat, PAST IND: A dog barked outside yesterday, FUTURE IND: There will be a meeting next week.
PRESENT IND: They abandon their old habits easily, PAST IND: He abandoned his car after it broke down on the highway, FUTURE IND: She will abandon her current project if it doesn’t work out.

PRESENT IND: He has the ability to solve complex problems, PAST IND: She had the ability to sing beautifully when she was younger, FUTURE IND: They will develop their ability to communicate effectively through practice.
PRESENT IND: She is able to complete the task on time, PAST IND: I was able to finish the report before the deadline, FUTURE IND: They will be able to join us for dinner tomorrow.
PRESENT IND: I’m thinking about his problem, PAST IND: He thought about his options before deciding, FUTURE IND: She will be thinking about her next steps.
PRESENT IND: The airplane flies above the clouds, PAST IND: The bird flew above the trees yesterday, FUTURE IND: We will look above for any signs of trouble.
PRESENT IND: She often travels abroad for work, PAST IND: He studied abroad last year, FUTURE IND: They will move abroad next month.
PRESENT IND: The results are absolute and cannot be disputed, PAST IND: His victory was absolute in the last election, FUTURE IND: They will seek absolute clarity on the issue.
PRESENT IND: She absolutely loves her new job, PAST IND: He was absolutely certain about his decision yesterday, FUTURE IND: They will absolutely support the new policy.
PRESENT IND: He is an academic who teaches history, PAST IND: She was an academic at the university last year, FUTURE IND: They will become academics in their field.
PRESENT IND: She accepts the offer gladly, PAST IND: He accepted the award yesterday, FUTURE IND: They will accept the challenge next week.
PRESENT IND: He has access to the database, PAST IND: She accessed the files yesterday, FUTURE IND: They will access the system tomorrow.
PRESENT IND: A car accident occurs daily, PAST IND: An accident happened on the highway yesterday, FUTURE IND: There will be an accident if they drive carelessly.
PRESENT IND: She accompanies him to school, PAST IND: He accompanied her to the event yesterday, FUTURE IND: They will accompany us on the trip.
PRESENT IND: According to the news, it will rain today, PAST IND: According to him, it rained yesterday, FUTURE IND: According to the forecast, it will snow tomorrow.
PRESENT IND: His calculations are accurate, PAST IND: Her prediction was accurate last week, FUTURE IND: They will ensure the data is accurate.

meaning: to say that someone has done something wrong
examples: PRESENT IND: They accuse him of cheating. PAST IND: She accused him of theft last year. FUTURE IND: The prosecutor will accuse the suspect in court.

meaning: to successfully complete or obtain something
examples: PRESENT IND: She will achieve her goals with hard work. PAST IND: He achieved his dreams after many years. FUTURE IND: They will achieve success together.
PRESENT IND: Winning the award is a significant achievement. PAST IND: Her graduation was a major achievement for her family. FUTURE IND: They will celebrate their achievement next week.

meaning: to accept or admit the existence or truth of
examples: PRESENT IND: We must acknowledge his contributions. PAST IND: They acknowledged her efforts in the meeting. FUTURE IND: She will acknowledge the support she received.

meaning: to gain possession or control of something
examples: PRESENT IND: They acquire new skills through practice. PAST IND: He acquired a taste for fine wines after traveling in Europe. FUTURE IND: She will acquire additional knowledge by attending workshops.

meaning: from one side to the other of something
examples: PRESENT IND: She travels across the country for work. PAST IND: They walked across the bridge yesterday. FUTURE IND: He will run across the field tomorrow.

meaning: to perform in a play or movie
examples: PRESENT IND: I will act in the school play. PAST IND: They acted well during the performance. FUTURE IND: She will act on her instincts.
PRESENT IND: The action takes place in the city. PAST IND: The action was thrilling to watch. FUTURE IND: They will plan their next action carefully.

meaning: doing things and involving a lot of movement
examples: PRESENT IND: She remains active in the community. PAST IND: He was active in sports during college. FUTURE IND: They will stay active through regular exercise.

meaning: a thing that you do for interest or pleasure
examples: PRESENT IND: Physical activity is important for health. PAST IND: The school organized a fun activity last week. FUTURE IND: There will be an exciting activity planned for the weekend.

meaning: a person who performs in plays or movies
examples: PRESENT IND: He is a talented actor. PAST IND: She always wanted to be an actor.
